skeletonlisp.ParserPckg
Class CondParser

java.lang.Object
  skeletonlisp.ParserPckg.CondParser

public class CondParser
extends java.lang.Object

CondParser is used to make Cond expressions. Cond expressions consist of zero or more CondCases. CondCases consist of one predicate expression and one result expression. Both the predicate and result can be any proper SkeletonLisp expression.

Thus the form of a Cond expression is:

(COND (PRED-1 RESULT-1)
(PRED-2 RESULT-2)
...
(PRED-n RESULT-n)

Method Detail

makeANewCond

public static LCond makeANewCond(java.lang.String exp)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
The method makeANewCond parses a String into an LCond.

Parameters:
exp - the Cond expression to be parsed, in a String form
Returns:
returns a new LCond that matches the semantic of the String representation.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if exp is not a syntactically correct Cond-expression, or if, for some reason, any of the predicates or the results cannot be parsed into proper SkeletonLisp expressions.
